name: liquidambar
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a kind of large deciduous tree (= one that loses its leaves in autumn and grows new ones in the spring) with brightly coloured, pointed leaves and round, prickly (= covered in sharp points) fruits : The trees used to build the local houses include pine and liquidambar. Liquidambars and birch add to the autumn display of colour.
More examplesFewer examplesThe plaza itself will be dotted with liquidambar trees and feature a flowing pool of water.The province was known for its thick forests of liquidambar.
